items.sentence: Tom is more experienced in business than I am.
Tom is more scared of Mary than she is of him.
Tom is not the kind of person you think he is.
Tom is often the last one to leave the office.
Tom is on the porch reading the evening paper.
It started raining just as I was leaving home.
You\'re not living in Boston anymore, are you?
You\'re not obligated to answer that question.
You\'re not really going to buy that, are you?
You\'re not supposed to have that information.
You\'re not the only one who needs to do that.
Tom is holding a lit candle in his right hand.
Tom just stood there watching everybody dance.
Tom deleted all the files off his thumb drive.
Tom did the right thing for the wrong reasons.
The Second World War lasted from 1939 to 1945.
Tom didn\'t anticipate that that would happen.
Are there any letters for me in today\'s mail?
Tom just stared at Mary without saying a word.
Tom\'s relatives in Boston have been notified.
Tom\'s school day is divided into six periods.
Tom\'s wife remarried shortly after his death.
I had to wait twenty minutes for the next bus.
I have about three times as many books as Tom.
I have something personal to discuss with Tom.
I have something personal to discuss with you.
I don\'t think that I\'ll tell Tom about this.
My teacher told me to read as much as I could.
No matter what I do, she says I can do better.
Oh, I just remembered. Tom left you a message.
Please check your valuables at the front desk.
It\'s time for you to tell me the whole truth.
I can\'t believe I didn\'t even think of that.
I\'ll phone you as soon as I arrive in Boston.
I\'ll try to jump over this stream on a horse.
I have to do my homework instead of going out.
I have to go to the airport to meet my cousin.
I need to ask Tom what to do about the matter.
I need to find a place to put all these books.
I need to practice speaking French more often.
I need you to tell me when you plan to arrive.

Do you think Tom might be part of the problem?
I want to meet people from all over the world.
I wonder how long this good weather will last.
You\'re not laying one finger on Tom\'s money.

Tom deals with that kind of problem every day.
Tom decided to go ahead let Mary have her way.
